newsitem.title: USA: MCI new ventures Q3 net loss lower.
newsitem.headline: MCI new ventures Q3 net loss lower.

text.p: MCI Communications Corp on Tuesday reported that its new ventures and developing markets subsidiary cut its net losses in the third quarter to $73 million from $109 million a year ago.

The unit, which groups MCI Metro; MCI Systemhouse; a stake in the Concert venture with British Telecommunications Plc; and several smaller operations, increased revenues to $474 million from $50 million a year ago.
The revenue rise was caused by the acquisition of Systemhouse and Nationwide Cellular during the period.
Revenues from MCI Metro's local telephone services rose 50 percent to $45 million from a year ago.
Deployment of networks for local service is running three months ahead of schedule, and lines installed quadrupled in the third quarter from the second, Maine said..

Concert, which provides global services for multinational corporations, has $1.5 billion of revenues currently under contract, Maine said, describing it as an "unqualified success." -- Nick Louth, New York Newsroom 212 859 1712
